## Recap the inference with exact function evaluations

Having observed $f$ at locations $\bf x$, we define $\bf\phi = f(\bf x)$, and $D = (\bf x, \bf\phi)$. Also suppose that 
$$
p(\bf\phi|\bf x) = \mathcal{N}(\bf\phi;\bf\mu,\bf\Sigma)
$$ {#eq-01}
